decks.notes: This deck focuses on a fast and aggressive strategy using spirits as the main creature type. The deck includes cards that allow you to disrupt your opponent's game plan, such as Spell Queller and Reflector Mage. It also includes cards that help you ramp and fix your mana, such as Noble Hierarch and Aether Vial. The deck utilizes the synergy between spirits and the tribal support cards, like Drogskol Captain and Supreme Phantom, to quickly overwhelm your opponent with a swarm of flying attackers.

The main focus of this deck is to assemble the Urza lands (Urza's Tower, Power Plant, and Mine) to generate a large amount of mana quickly and efficiently. This mana is used to cast powerful threats like Wurmcoil Engine, Walking Ballista, World Breaker, Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger, and Ugin, the Spirit Dragon. The deck also includes various control elements like Oblivion Stone, Relic of Progenitus, and Karn Liberated to disrupt the opponent's game plan and protect its own board state. Overall, the goal is to overwhelm the opponent with big threats while controlling the battlefield.

This deck focuses on quickly assembling the Amulet of Vigor combo with Primeval Titan to generate a massive amount of mana and search for key lands like Boros Garrison and Sunhome, Fortress of the Legion to finish off opponents. Trinket Mage is used to search for silver bullet artifacts like Walking Ballista and Engineered Explosives for removal and control. The deck uses Azusa, Lost but Seeking and Sakura-Tribe Scout to ramp and accelerate its mana production, while also including utility lands like Bojuka Bog and Ghost Quarter for disruption and protection.

This deck focuses on utilizing a combination of aggressive creatures, disruption, and mana acceleration to overwhelm the opponent quickly. By efficiently deploying powerful Human creatures with abilities that boost each other, disrupt the opponent's game plan, and take advantage of tribal synergies, the deck aims to maintain pressure from the early turns of the game. The inclusion of Aether Vial allows for creatures to be put into play at instant speed, providing flexibility and surprise factor in combat. The deck's mana base is designed to support a variety of colored mana requirements for its creatures.

The deck focuses on flooding the board with powerful Spirit creatures that benefit from each other's presence, such as Geist of Saint Traft and Drogskol Captain. The key strategy is to use Aether Vial to cheat creatures into play and disrupt the opponent's game plan with counterspells like Spell Queller. The deck seeks to maintain a fast and aggressive pace by utilizing efficient creatures like Supreme Phantom and Mausoleum Wanderer, while also providing protection with Selfless Spirit. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with a swarm of evasive threats and control the game with tempo plays.

This deck focuses on quickly reducing your own life total to make Death's Shadow a powerful threat on the battlefield. Using a combination of disruption, removal, and card draw, the deck aims to control the game while applying pressure with large creatures like Gurmag Angler and Death's Shadow. By efficiently using life as a resource and disrupting opponent's strategies, the deck can quickly close out games before the opponent has a chance to stabilize.

The deck focuses on assembling a board of aggressive Human creatures quickly, with cards like Champion of the Parish and Thalia's Lieutenant growing in power as more Humans enter the battlefield. Aether Vial allows for instant creature deployment, while cards like Reflector Mage and Meddling Mage disrupt opponent's strategies. The deck also utilizes a mana base that supports its multicolor creatures, with powerful lands like Cavern of Souls and Ancient Ziggurat. Overall, the key concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and disruptive Human aggro strategy.

The deck is focused on utilizing the Dredge mechanic to maximize graveyard interactions and generate value. It aims to fill the graveyard quickly through cards like Faithless Looting and Cathartic Reunion, and then utilizes cards like Life from the Loam and Stinkweed Imp to dredge and bring back powerful creatures like Narcomoeba and Prized Amalgam. The deck also includes cards like Creeping Chill and Conflagrate to deal damage and close out games. The key concept is to exploit the graveyard as a resource to fuel explosive and synergistic plays.

The deck focuses on quickly casting low-cost spells to trigger Arclight Phoenix's ability and bring it back from the graveyard. Utilizing cards like Faithless Looting, Gut Shot, and Lightning Bolt, the deck aims to control the board while also dealing damage to the opponent. Thing in the Ice provides a solid defensive option while also potentially turning into a powerful threat. The deck also includes cantrips like Serum Visions and Opt to help dig for key cards and maintain card advantage. The mana base is designed to support the deck's UR color identity and maximize efficiency.

The main concept of this Aggro - Arclight Phoenix deck is to quickly fill up the graveyard with spells and then use cards like Faithless Looting and Thought Scour to bring back Arclight Phoenix for multiple attacks. Cards like Lightning Bolt and Crackling Drake provide additional damage and control, while Thing in the Ice can help clear the board for a final push. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with fast, efficient spells and creatures, utilizing card draw and mana fixing to maintain momentum.

The main concept of this Dredge deck is to maximize graveyard interaction and recursion in order to quickly fill the graveyard with cards that synergize to create a powerful board presence. By using cards like Life from the Loam, Faithless Looting, and Creeping Chill to quickly fill the graveyard, the deck can bring back creatures like Prized Amalgam and Bloodghast while also dealing damage with abilities like Conflagrate. This deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a constant stream of threats from the graveyard while controlling the board through efficient graveyard manipulation.

The key concept of this deck is to quickly assemble the needed cards to execute the Ad Nauseam combo. The deck aims to generate a large amount of mana through cards like Lotus Bloom and Pentad Prism, while also manipulating the top of the library with Serum Visions and Sleight of Hand to find the key cards. The deck then uses Ad Nauseam to draw the entire deck, exploiting Angel's Grace and Phyrexian Unlife to avoid losing the game due to drawing out. Laboratory Maniac serves as the win condition, while counter spells like Pact of Negation protect the combo.

This deck focuses on quickly reducing your own life total to power up Death's Shadow, while utilizing efficient removal spells like Assassin's Trophy, Thoughtseize, and Lightning Bolt to control the board and disrupt the opponent's game plan. Traverse the Ulvenwald helps to tutor for key creatures like Tarmogoyf or Death's Shadow, while Liliana of the Veil provides additional disruption and card advantage. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with an aggressive start and finish the game with powerful threats like Death's Shadow backed up by removal and disruption spells.

The deck focuses on efficiently tutoring for and assembling a combo using Devoted Druid and Vizier of Remedies to generate infinite mana. This combo allows for quick and explosive plays through Eldritch Evolution and Chord of Calling to search for key pieces and win conditions like Walking Ballista. The deck also utilizes toolbox creatures like Eternal Witness and Shalai, Voice of Plenty to provide protection and resilience against various strategies, while also incorporating mana dorks like Birds of Paradise and Noble Hierarch to accelerate its game plan.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize the dredge mechanic to fill up the graveyard with key cards like Creeping Chill, Stinkweed Imp, Prized Amalgam, and Narcomoeba. By repeatedly dredging cards back into the hand, the deck can quickly populate the battlefield with powerful creatures and disrupt the opponent's game plan. Cathartic Reunion and Faithless Looting help to draw cards and fuel the graveyard, while Conflagrate serves as a finisher. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a steady stream of threats from the graveyard.

The deck focuses on utilizing +1/+1 counters to create powerful creatures and win through aggressive tactics. Cards like Arcbound Ravager, Hangarback Walker, and Walking Ballista benefit from the presence of Hardened Scales, increasing their potency. Steel Overseer helps to further grow the board state, while Ancient Stirrings and Mox Opal provide card advantage and mana acceleration. The deck also includes cards like Animation Module and Evolutionary Leap for additional synergy and resilience. Overall, the strategy revolves around quickly building up a threatening board presence and overwhelming the opponent with efficient creatures.
